snippet: After one commissioner called the handling of the Rangel-Espaillat race a “fiasco,” the much-maligned Board of Elections sought improvements in time for September.
abstract: New York City Board of Elections meets to certify the results of recent Congressional primary, focusing on the messy contest in the 13th Congressional District, where leading Democratic candidates were Rep Charles B Rangel and State Senator Adriano Espaillat; board declares Rangel the winner, but several commissioners express lengthy grievances about the election and board's Republican commissioner, Juan Carlos Polanco, agrees that urgent action is needed to prevent future ballot counting problems.
lead_paragraph: After one commissioner called the handling of the Rangel-Espaillat race a “fiasco,” the much-maligned Board of Elections sought improvements in time for September.

headline.seo: New York City Elections Board Chafes at Criticism, but Seeks Improvements
headline.main: City Board of Elections Says Criticism Was Unfair
headline.print_headline: City Board Of Elections Says Criticism Was Unfair
